Claim: A bovine coronavirus vaccine, for cattle, is proof that the novel coronavirus isn’t “new” and is evidence of “how much the media controls people.”
Explaination: The cattle vaccine has nothing to do with the COVID-19 virus.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A bovine coronavirus vaccine, for cattle, is proof that the novel coronavirus isn’t “new” and is evidence of “how much the media controls people.”

Explanation:The cattle vaccine has nothing to do with the COVID-19 virus.

https://www.factcheck.org/2020/03/cattle-vaccine-not-related-to-2019-novel-coronavirus/

Claim: Work suspension in Ecuador due to coronavirus since Monday 09/03/2020.
Explaination: Please click the link to read the full article
Label: False
html:
Claim: Work suspension in Ecuador due to coronavirus since Monday 09/03/2020.

Claim: Video tries to show coronavirus is fake and not dangerous.
Explaination: This is one of many similar conspiracy theories.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Video tries to show coronavirus is fake and not dangerous.

Explanation:This is one of many similar conspiracy theories.

https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2020/04/fact-check-'coronahoax'-video-offers-NO-proof-COVID-19-is-anything-but-real-and-deadly.html

Claim: “An entire family” in Santolan, Pasig, is “confirmed to be infected” with the novel coronavirus, according to what looked like a breaking news graphic from GMA News.
Explaination: Pasig City Mayor Vico Sotto called the graphic a “fake ‘GMA’ post.” Moreover, the social media team of GMA News said they did not release the “JUST IN” graphic that circulated online.
Label: False
html:
Claim: “An entire family” in Santolan, Pasig, is “confirmed to be infected” with the novel coronavirus, according to what looked like a breaking news graphic from GMA News.

Explanation:Pasig City Mayor Vico Sotto called the graphic a “fake ‘GMA’ post.” Moreover, the social media team of GMA News said they did not release the “JUST IN” graphic that circulated online.

https://www.rappler.com/newsbreak/fact-check/253981-entire-family-pasig-infected-novel-coronavirus

Claim: Boiled orange peels with cayenne pepper are a cure for coronavirus.
Explaination: There is still currently no cure, and this has not been medically verified as a viable treatment.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Boiled orange peels with cayenne pepper are a cure for coronavirus.

Explanation:There is still currently no cure, and this has not been medically verified as a viable treatment.

https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2020/03/fact-check-boiled-orange-peels-with-cayenne-pepper-are-not-effective-treatment-for-coronavirus.html

Claim: Four patients infected with the coronavirus are hospitalized in Sri Lanka.
Explaination: Only two suspect patients were hospitalized and both later tested negative.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Four patients infected with the coronavirus are hospitalized in Sri Lanka.

Explanation:Only two suspect patients were hospitalized and both later tested negative.

https://factcheck.afp.com/sri-lankan-authorities-say-only-two-suspected-coronavirus-patients-were-hospitalised-and-both-later

Claim: A post has been shared on Facebook, Twitter and Whatsapp claims a regional government in India has recommended that the juice of bitter gourd, a vegetable often used in traditional medicine, is an effective treatment for the novel coronavirus.
Explaination: The claim is false; Indian authorities dismissed the claim, calling it “absolutely false”; health experts said there is no evidence the vegetable is an effective remedy for COVID-19.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A post has been shared on Facebook, Twitter and Whatsapp claims a regional government in India has recommended that the juice of bitter gourd, a vegetable often used in traditional medicine, is an effective treatment for the novel coronavirus.

Explanation:The claim is false; Indian authorities dismissed the claim, calling it “absolutely false”; health experts said there is no evidence the vegetable is an effective remedy for COVID-19.

https://factcheck.afp.com/indian-health-authorities-refute-myth-juiced-vegetables-can-cure-covid-19

Claim: Drinking a bleach solution will prevent you from getting the coronavirus.
Explaination: Officials have repeatedly warned consumers against ingesting it, saying doing so could cause severe vomiting and liver failure.
Label: Pants on Fire!
html:
Claim: Drinking a bleach solution will prevent you from getting the coronavirus.

Explanation:Officials have repeatedly warned consumers against ingesting it, saying doing so could cause severe vomiting and liver failure.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/jan/30/tweets/no-drinking-bleach-will-not-ward-coronavirus/

Claim: A post shows a rail freight tanker with “COVID-19” stamped on one side.
Explaination: The image has circulated globally but it is false, the tanker operating company said. And Railinc, a corporation that manages an industry-wide database, said there is no such mark as “COVID.”
Label: False
html:
Claim: A post shows a rail freight tanker with “COVID-19” stamped on one side.

Explanation:The image has circulated globally but it is false, the tanker operating company said. And Railinc, a corporation that manages an industry-wide database, said there is no such mark as “COVID.”

https://factcheck.afp.com/photo-covid-19-rail-tanker-not-genuine-0

Claim: 10 coronavirus cases are confirmed in Ecuador.
Explaination: Please click the link to read the full article
Label: False
html:
Claim: 10 coronavirus cases are confirmed in Ecuador.

Explanation:Please click the link to read the full article

http://www.ecuadorchequea.com/ecuador-10-casos-positivos-para-coronavirus/?fbclid=IwAR1i-e5y3cPTG5WPJhuipV9cA_Ly5vPlz2dBTtczgID5peTbenUb7B8gCEg?check=2

Claim: “During the 2009 swine flu outbreak, Biden made reckless comments unsupported by science & the experts. The Obama Admin had to clean up his mess & apologize for his ineptitude.”
Explaination: During the 2009 swine flu outbreak, Biden said he would advise his family against traveling in confined places and said when one person sneezes “it goes all the way through an aircraft.” Scientists say that’s not how germs spread. Biden’s comments were met with backlash and his spokesperson issued a clarification.
Label: MOSTLY TRUE
html:
Claim: “During the 2009 swine flu outbreak, Biden made reckless comments unsupported by science & the experts. The Obama Admin had to clean up his mess & apologize for his ineptitude.”

Explanation:During the 2009 swine flu outbreak, Biden said he would advise his family against traveling in confined places and said when one person sneezes “it goes all the way through an aircraft.” Scientists say that’s not how germs spread. Biden’s comments were met with backlash and his spokesperson issued a clarification.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/13/donald-trump/fact-checking-trump-campaign-claim-bidens-2009-swi/

Claim: In the Philippines, Senator Manny Pacquiao was the only senator who responded to the coronavirus crisis.
Explaination: Other senators, and not just Pacquiao, also responded to the outbreak by providing aid to frontliners and those affected by the enhanced community quarantine, among others.
Label: False
html:
Claim: In the Philippines, Senator Manny Pacquiao was the only senator who responded to the coronavirus crisis.

Explanation:Other senators, and not just Pacquiao, also responded to the outbreak by providing aid to frontliners and those affected by the enhanced community quarantine, among others.

https://www.rappler.com/newsbreak/fact-check/256489-pacquiao-was-only-senator-responded-coronavirus-crisis

Claim: Pier Luigi Bersani: None of the confirmed cases are related to China. Coronavirus might have occured in Italy before China.
Explaination: In the interview, Bersani didn't say that the virus is originated from Italy. In contrast, he emphasized that the virus is from China. His point is to bring up the assumption that the virus came to Italy prior to the time WHO declared the emergency.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Pier Luigi Bersani: None of the confirmed cases are related to China. Coronavirus might have occured in Italy before China.

Explanation:In the interview, Bersani didn't say that the virus is originated from Italy. In contrast, he emphasized that the virus is from China. His point is to bring up the assumption that the virus came to Italy prior to the time WHO declared the emergency.

https://tfc-taiwan.org.tw/articles/2941

Claim: “The Chinese Communist Party is using Zoom as a way to spy on our citizens.”
Explaination: The claim is based on a report from researchers at the University of Toronto. But one of the researchers told us that while they identified security issues with Zoom, whether China has exploited the platform for espionage was not something they considered.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: “The Chinese Communist Party is using Zoom as a way to spy on our citizens.”

Explanation:The claim is based on a report from researchers at the University of Toronto. But one of the researchers told us that while they identified security issues with Zoom, whether China has exploited the platform for espionage was not something they considered.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/apr/07/charlie-kirk/china-spying-you-through-zoom-charlie-kirk-oversta/

Claim: Photo of an Italian doctor waving goodbye to co-doctors as he is about to die due to coronavirus.
Explaination: The viral photo was taken at a hospital in China's Wuhan when the team of doctors was treating a COVID-19 patient.
Label: half true
html:
Claim: Photo of an Italian doctor waving goodbye to co-doctors as he is about to die due to coronavirus.

Explanation:The viral photo was taken at a hospital in China's Wuhan when the team of doctors was treating a COVID-19 patient.

https://www.indiatoday.in/fact-check/story/misleading-claim-about-covid19-patient-goes-viral-1663343-2020-04-04

Claim: The WHO offered the testing kits that they have available and to give it to us now. We refused them. We did not want to buy them.”
Explaination: The WHO never offered to sell test kits to the United States. The CDC opted to develop its own coronavirus test and did not use the WHO’s protocol for the test.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: The WHO offered the testing kits that they have available and to give it to us now. We refused them. We did not want to buy them.”

Explanation:The WHO never offered to sell test kits to the United States. The CDC opted to develop its own coronavirus test and did not use the WHO’s protocol for the test.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/16/joe-biden/biden-falsely-says-trump-administration-rejected-w/

Claim: A video has been viewed hundreds of thousands of times on Facebook, Twitter and YouTube alongside a claim that it shows a drone launching fireworks at people who breached a curfew in Malaysia during a nationwide coronavirus lockdown.
Explaination: The claim is false; the video's audio has been manipulated to include a man speaking in Malaysian; the original clip actually shows a prank that was staged by a Brazilian influencer in Brazil in July 2019.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video has been viewed hundreds of thousands of times on Facebook, Twitter and YouTube alongside a claim that it shows a drone launching fireworks at people who breached a curfew in Malaysia during a nationwide coronavirus lockdown.

Explanation:The claim is false; the video's audio has been manipulated to include a man speaking in Malaysian; the original clip actually shows a prank that was staged by a Brazilian influencer in Brazil in July 2019.

https://factcheck.afp.com/video-has-circulated-online-about-prank-staged-brazil-2019

Claim: Numerous conspiracy theories shared on and off social media claim that 5G mobile networks are the cause of the novel coronavirus pandemic.
Explaination: This is false; experts told AFP that 5G is based on radio frequency and that this does not create viruses.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Numerous conspiracy theories shared on and off social media claim that 5G mobile networks are the cause of the novel coronavirus pandemic.

Explanation:This is false; experts told AFP that 5G is based on radio frequency and that this does not create viruses.

https://factcheck.afp.com/experts-dismiss-claims-5g-wireless-technology-created-novel-coronavirus

Claim: Garlic water can cure novel coronavirus.
Explaination: Garlic is a healthy food that may have some antimicrobial properties. However, there is no evidence from the current outbreak that eating garlic has protected people from the new coronavirus.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Garlic water can cure novel coronavirus.

Explanation:Garlic is a healthy food that may have some antimicrobial properties. However, there is no evidence from the current outbreak that eating garlic has protected people from the new coronavirus.

https://www.vishvasnews.com/english/health/fact-check-post-claiming-garlic-water-can-cure-novel-coronavirus-is-fake/

Claim: The CDC now says that the coronavirus can survive on surfaces for up to 17 days.
Explaination: A CNBC story touted a misleading headline that said the CDC reported that the coronavirus survived on cruise ship cabins for up to 17 days. A recent CDC report found that traces of the virus were found on the ship for that long, not a live sample.
Label: False
html:
Claim: The CDC now says that the coronavirus can survive on surfaces for up to 17 days.

Explanation:A CNBC story touted a misleading headline that said the CDC reported that the coronavirus survived on cruise ship cabins for up to 17 days. A recent CDC report found that traces of the virus were found on the ship for that long, not a live sample.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/26/facebook-posts/theres-no-evidence-covid-19-can-survive-surfaces-1/

Claim: A claim that 500 body bags were delivered to an ice skating rink outside the Australian city of Adelaide has been shared widely on Facebook during the novel coronavirus pandemic.
Explaination: The claim is false; South Australian health authorities said the claim is a “myth” and a spokesperson for the local ice rink said “the rumour is completely false”.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A claim that 500 body bags were delivered to an ice skating rink outside the Australian city of Adelaide has been shared widely on Facebook during the novel coronavirus pandemic.

Explanation:The claim is false; South Australian health authorities said the claim is a “myth” and a spokesperson for the local ice rink said “the rumour is completely false”.

https://factcheck.afp.com/its-myth-south-australian-health-authorities-dismiss-rumour-about-ice-rink-turned-morgue-covid-19

Claim: A photo shows people infected with coronavirus  lying on the sidewalk in China.
Explaination: It was an artistic performance in germany in 2014.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A photo shows people infected with coronavirus lying on the sidewalk in China.

Explanation:It was an artistic performance in germany in 2014.

https://factcheck.afp.com/2014-photo-people-participating-art-project-frankfurt-germany

Claim: A video shows a bat-infested roof in Hubei, China, claiming to be the source of the new coronavirus.
Explaination: This video dates back to 2011, which is almost 9 years ago. This video is from Miami, Florida, USA and has nothing to do with Novel coronavirus and China.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video shows a bat-infested roof in Hubei, China, claiming to be the source of the new coronavirus.

Explanation:This video dates back to 2011, which is almost 9 years ago. This video is from Miami, Florida, USA and has nothing to do with Novel coronavirus and China.

https://english.factcrescendo.com/chinas-source-for-coronavirus/

Claim: The coronavirus has been discovered in poultry.
Explaination: Sri Lankan authorities said the coronavirus has not been discovered in poultry; the photos were taken from various unrelated reports online and show chickens sickened with other diseases.
Label: False
ann23_remarks: I didn't mark it as virus origin even though it's about being found in animals as it doesn't seem to be saying it originated in chickens; similarly it doesn't quite fit the definition of transmissino which seems to be only about people.
html:
Claim: The coronavirus has been discovered in poultry.

Explanation:Sri Lankan authorities said the coronavirus has not been discovered in poultry; the photos were taken from various unrelated reports online and show chickens sickened with other diseases.

https://factcheck.afp.com/sri-lankan-officials-refute-false-claim-novel-coronavirus-has-been-discovered-poultry

Claim: Whether coronavirus began with man having sex with a bat.
Explaination: This came from a clear satire website as fake.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Whether coronavirus began with man having sex with a bat.

Explanation:This came from a clear satire website as fake.

https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2020/03/Fact-Check-Coronavirus-'Patient-Zero'-Is-NOT-A-Man-Who-Had-Sex-With-A-Bat.html

Claim: PM Modi on 4/2/20 announced extension of a nationwide lockdown until 5/4/20.
Explaination: PM Modi has not made any announcement for extension of nationwide lockdown till 4 May 2020. The image is digitally edited.
Label: False
html:
Claim: PM Modi on 4/2/20 announced extension of a nationwide lockdown until 5/4/20.

Explanation:PM Modi has not made any announcement for extension of nationwide lockdown till 4 May 2020. The image is digitally edited.

https://english.factcrescendo.com/2020/04/02/pm-modi-has-announced-extension-of-nationwide-lockdown-till-4-may-2020/

Claim: Italian PM said that the country has surrendered to the COVID-19 pandemic
Explaination: The quote attributed to Italian PM is made up.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Italian PM said that the country has surrendered to the COVID-19 pandemic

Explanation:The quote attributed to Italian PM is made up.

https://www.indiatoday.in/fact-check/story/fact-check-viral-post-saying-italian-pm-surrendered-to-covid-19-is-fake-1660310-2020-03-27?check=3

Claim: China officially said the new coronavirus had “confirmed aerosol infection” and that “in short, airborne infections” were spread.
Explaination: Aerosol infections are rare and different from airborne infections.
Label: False
html:
Claim: China officially said the new coronavirus had “confirmed aerosol infection” and that “in short, airborne infections” were spread.

Explanation:Aerosol infections are rare and different from airborne infections.

https://www.buzzfeed.com/jp/kotahatachi/unknown-cause-china-10

Claim: NYT invented the video of a doctor fighting coronavirus in hospital.
Explaination: The video is real and Dr. Colleen Smith does work at the hospital, unlike the Tweet claims.
Label: False
html:
Claim: NYT invented the video of a doctor fighting coronavirus in hospital.

Explanation:The video is real and Dr. Colleen Smith does work at the hospital, unlike the Tweet claims.

https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2020/04/fact-check-nytimes-did-not-invent-doctor-fighting-coronavirus-in-qanon-conspiracy-theory.html

Claim: Costco recalls toilet paper because it’s infected with the coronavirus.
Explaination: The notice is not authentic, according to a statement from the wholesaler, and the brand of bath tissue in question is not listed on official recall websites.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Costco recalls toilet paper because it’s infected with the coronavirus.

Explanation:The notice is not authentic, according to a statement from the wholesaler, and the brand of bath tissue in question is not listed on official recall websites.

https://factcheck.afp.com/costco-not-recalling-bath-tissue-due-novel-coronavirus-contamination?fbclid=IwAR1TBUpUk_Y_6RW_VqxxUBmU-bhJ7iNrUSmYHmoTnH0Fb9_-hKJiNzaLrfY

Claim: “THE CHINESE HAVE BEGUN TO USE THEIR HUMAN CORPSE TO PROCESS INTO PRODUCTS SUCH AS CORNED BEEF TO SHIP TO AFRICA. Please share with your contacts. Very important”
Explaination: The video might be of Tibet or China’s Sichuan as residents of both these territories perform such rituals. However, we haven’t found the origin of this claim hence we can not emphasize whether or not visuals in this video belong to Sky Burial. But from our findings it is evident that the video is in no way related to the coronavirus outbreak.
Label: False
html:
Claim: “THE CHINESE HAVE BEGUN TO USE THEIR HUMAN CORPSE TO PROCESS INTO PRODUCTS SUCH AS CORNED BEEF TO SHIP TO AFRICA. Please share with your contacts. Very important”

Explanation:The video might be of Tibet or China’s Sichuan as residents of both these territories perform such rituals. However, we haven’t found the origin of this claim hence we can not emphasize whether or not visuals in this video belong to Sky Burial. But from our findings it is evident that the video is in no way related to the coronavirus outbreak.

https://www.newschecker.in/article/news-detail/275_14817124

Claim: A photo showing Uganda’s first case of COVID-19.
Explaination: The photo of a man wearing a mask does not show Uganda's first COVID-19 case, but was actually taken at the John F Kennedy International Airport in February 2020.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A photo showing Uganda’s first case of COVID-19.

Explanation:The photo of a man wearing a mask does not show Uganda's first COVID-19 case, but was actually taken at the John F Kennedy International Airport in February 2020.

https://pesacheck.org/false-this-man-wearing-a-face-mask-is-not-ugandas-first-confirmed-covid-19-case-1b1e29fc40c9?source=rss----ab41f21aa9a9---4

Claim: Pope Francis and his two aides have been infected with the new coronavirus
Explaination: Pope tested negative.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Pope Francis and his two aides have been infected with the new coronavirus

Explanation:Pope tested negative.

https://www.factcheck.org/2020/03/article-falsely-reports-on-health-of-pope-francis/
